ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 4 sometimes more depending on exams and projects.
1-3 hours
Spent 10-15 hours outside the classroom
about 6 hours/ week

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: This was an excellent class and provided a unique perspective.

In depth analysis of several diseases instead of general overview of all vector-borne and zoonotic diseases. I can honestly say I learned alot about the ecology of such diseases. weaknesses of the course were due to a slight lack of organization in the schedule of the course. Debates and assignments were poorly structured and not explained clearly by insructor
Great course... One of the best classes taken at EMD and EPH... Labs help you understand the material being taught in class

It was a good introduction to ecological concepts and trying to incorporate those into an epi base that public health students have. It was a particularly useful for class for those wanting to study the interaction of human health with that of vector and animal diseases.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Maria Diuk-Wasser  excellent teacher that is very invested in the success of all her students.
Instructor: Maria Diuk-Wasser  Great person. Intelligent. Not always the best when it comes to organization, but overall great person.
Instructor: Maria Diuk-Wasser  Very Helpful and easy to approach

Instructor: Maria Diuk-Wasser  She was very willing to meet outside of class and very much wanted us to be involved in class plus it was a small class which facilitated a bit more discussion. I did feel she was a rapid speaker but overall was easy to follow.

narratives.question_text: If this course included instruction by a teaching assistant (TA), please evaluate the TA here. What are the strengths and weaknesses and how might their teaching be improved? (Specify name of the TA).
comments: She was very helpful and presented really well.
Very helpful. Provided great input during the course.
Helpful with labs
Kim was very helpful and excellent at leading and organizing the lab sessions.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Take this course if you want a truly unique perspective.
A great look into the ecology of these diseases. Small intimate group. Like all courses it has its pluses and minuses.

Learn about vector borne and zoonotic diseases: malaria, dengue, lyme, west nile, rabies, influenzaLearn how to write a grantIntroductions to GIS, Spatial Analysis tools, and EMD Epi methodsHighly Recommend... A must take... Especially helpful for first years
It was overall a good course although did not focus much on zoonotic disease agents unless they wererelated to vectors.
Yes, especially for people in EMD.
